world-cup-light.comment: Currently being used as a light background for World Cup Brackets

world-cup-dark.comment: Currently being used as a dark background for World Cup Brackets

ncaa.comment: Applies to both basketball (NCAAB) and football (NCAAF)

pine.comment:
For use on:
- Light surfaces as a logo color
- as a background color

gold.comment:
For use on:
- Light surfaces as a logo color
- Dark surfaces as a logo color

Also known as: Caesars Gold

cool-gray.comment:
For use on:
- Dark surfaces as a logo color

graphic-positive.comment: Can be used to show a positive trajectory

graphic-negative.comment: Can be used to show a negative trajectory

graphic-info.comment: Can be used for weather, yellow cards

graphic-cool.comment: Can be used to show a cooling down trajectory

ui-background-hover.comment: Dropdown hover, calendar hover, switch hover

disabled.comment: Any graphics that need a disabled color

ui-background.comment: Calendar bg, radio button bg, checkbox bg, form fields bg

ui-background-disabled.comment: Disabled UI like checkboxes, calendars or fields

ui-element-active.comment: Indicate tab is active, radio button is on

icon-secondary.comment: Icon color when primary cannot be used

secondary.comment: The lowest & darkest surface, usually used to lift the primary surface

tertiary.comment: *Only used on Primary Surface. Commonly used for metadata.

disabled.comment: Not actionable. Does not need to meet AA contrast

selected.comment: Selected date in calendar, selected tab menu item or dropdown

unselected.comment: Eg. Unselected date in calendar, unselected tab menu item or dropdown

positive.comment: Positive status such as a win (W)

negative.comment: Do not use on tertiary surfaces. Negative status such as a loss (L).

alert.comment: Do not use on tertiary surfaces. Urgent info like watch now & live events.

primary.comment: Can be used to promote brand where other colors cannot be used

secondary.comment: Promote brand where primary brand cannot be used

tertiary.comment: Promote brand where primary & seceondary brand cannot be used
*Only used on Primary Surface. Commonly used for metadata.

disabled.comment: Not actionable. Does not need to meet AA contrast

selected.comment: Selected date in calendar, selected tab menu item or dropdown

unselected.comment: Unselected date in calendar, unselected tab menu item or dropdown

positive.comment: Positive status such as a win (W)

negative.comment: Negative status such as a loss (L)

alert.comment: Urgent info like watch now & live events

primary.comment: Can be used to promote brand where other colors cannot be used

secondary.comment: Promote brand where primary brand cannot be used

tertiary.comment: Promote brand where primary & seceondary brand cannot be used

border-secondary.comment: A secondary border color may be required for darker rows or cols

row-background-secondary.comment: For striped table rows or accent rows

text-secondary.comment: Secondary body text color when default cannot be used

column-background-1.comment: First tint for table body column

column-background-2.comment: Second tint for table body column

row-background-hover.comment: Default hover color for body rows

modal-background.comment: Default bg for modal popups to sit on

secondary.comment: The lowest & darkest surface, usually used to lift the primary surface

brand.comment: Can be used for nav or areas to promote brand
